diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Catastrophic polyethylene failure and wear-through of the titanium acetabular component
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with squeaking noise, pain in the right hip, and severe acetabular wear-through indicated by radiographs. Preoperative lab values showed renal insufficiency correlating with elevated serum metal-ion levels. Improvement in renal function was observed post-revision surgery, along with a decrease in metal-ion levels, suggesting a relationship between metallosis and renal impairment.
